context.p: On a global scale, bats take a wide variety of food, including fruit, leaves, bark, nectar, pollen, winged insects, beetles, bugs and termites, spiders, small mammals (especially rodents) birds, lizards, amphibians (especially frogs), scorpions, other bats and fish. Some bats, i.e. the notorious vampire bats, will feed on the blood of mammals and birds.
